org.kitteh.irc.client.library

Interface Client

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ClientLinked
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Client.WithManagement
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultClient

    public interface Client
extends ClientLinked
    An individual IRC connection, see builder() to create one.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Client.Builder
      Builds Clients.
      static interface  Client.Commands
      Provides commands.
      static class  Client.ProxyType
      Types of proxy supported.
      static interface  Client.WithManagement
      A Client with management features.

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        static @NonNull Client.Builder builder()
        Creates a Client.Builder to build clients.
        Returns:
        a client builder

      • addChannel

        void addChannel(String... channels)
        Adds channels to this client.

        Joins the channels if already connected.

        Parameters:
        channels - channel(s) to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if null or invalid
        See Also:
        RequestedChannelJoinCompleteEvent, UnexpectedChannelLeaveEvent

      • addKeyProtectedChannel

        void addKeyProtectedChannel(@NonNull String channel,
                            @NonNull String key)
        Adds a key-protected channel to this client.

        Joins the channels if already connected.

        Parameters:
        channel - channel to add
        key - channel key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if null or invalid

      • addKeyProtectedChannel

        void addKeyProtectedChannel(Pair<String,String>... channelsAndKeys)
        Adds key-protected channels to this client.

        Joins the channels if already connected.

        Parameters:
        channelsAndKeys - pairs of channel, key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if null or invalid

      • getChannel

        @NonNull Optional<Channel> getChannel(@NonNull String name)
        Gets the named channel.
        Parameters:
        name - channel name
        Returns:
        a channel snapshot of the named channel if tracked by the client
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null
        See Also:
        getChannels()

      • getChannels

        @NonNull Set<Channel> getChannels()
        Gets the channels in which the client is currently present.
        Returns:
        the client's current channels

      • getChannels

        @NonNull Set<Channel> getChannels(@NonNull Collection<String> channels)
        Gets the channels on the given collection in which the client is currently present.
        Parameters:
        channels - collection of channel names to get
        Returns:
        the client's current channels that are named in the collection

      • getDefaultMessageMap

        @NonNull DefaultMessageMap getDefaultMessageMap()
        Gets the message manager for default messages to reply with when certain messages are being sent. Like a KICK, PART, or QUIT reason.
        Returns:
        the DefaultMessageMap

      • getEventManager

        @NonNull EventManager getEventManager()
        Gets the client's event manager.
        Returns:
        the event manager for this client

      • getExceptionListener

        @NonNull Listener<Exception> getExceptionListener()
        Gets the exception listener.
        Returns:
        the exception listener

      • getIntendedNick

        @NonNull String getIntendedNick()
        Gets the nickname the client intends to possess. May not reflect the current nickname if it's taken. The client will automatically attempt to take back this nickname.

        Use getNick() for the current nick.

        Returns:
        the nickname the client tries to maintain

      • getStsMachine

        @NonNull Optional<StsMachine> getStsMachine()
        Gets the STS machine instance, if one is in use.
        Returns:
        the machine, may not be present

      • getISupportManager

        @NonNull ISupportManager getISupportManager()
        Gets the manager of ISUPPORT info.
        Returns:
        the ISUPPORT manager

      • getMessageCutter

        @NonNull Cutter getMessageCutter()
        Gets the current message cutter for multi-line messages.
        Returns:
        message cutter

      • getMessageSendingQueueSupplier

        @NonNull Function<Client.WithManagement,? extends MessageSendingQueue> getMessageSendingQueueSupplier()
        Gets the message sending queue supplier. Default supplies a SingleDelaySender with a delay of 1200.
        Returns:
        the supplier

      • getMessageTagManager

        @NonNull MessageTagManager getMessageTagManager()
        Gets the message tag manager.
        Returns:
        message tag manager

      • getName

        @NonNull String getName()
        Gets the client name. This name is just an internal name for reference and is not visible from IRC.
        Returns:
        the client name

      • getNick

        @NonNull String getNick()
        Gets the current nickname the client has.
        Returns:
        the current nick

      • getServerInfo

        @NonNull ServerInfo getServerInfo()
        Gets information about the server to which the client is currently connected. As long as the client remains connected the information returned by this object will update according to information received from the server. A new one can be acquired from ClientNegotiationCompleteEvent
        Returns:
        the server information object

      • getUser

        @NonNull Optional<User> getUser()
        Gets the User that the client is represented by. Will return Optional.empty() until the Client is in a Channel for which joining has completed, meaning full user info is available.
        Returns:
        the user of this client if known

      • getUserModes

        @NonNull Optional<ModeStatusList<UserMode>> getUserModes()
        Gets the user's modes. Will return Optional.empty() until the Client has queried this information, which is requested after the connection registration has completed.
        Returns:
        user modes of this client if known

      • isUser

        default boolean isUser(@Nullable User user)
        Checks to see if this client is the same as the given user.
        Parameters:
        user - user to check this client against
        Returns:
        true if this client is the user, false if not

        void knockChannel(@NonNull String channelName)
        KNOCKs on a +i (but not +p) channel, requesting an INVITE.
        Parameters:
        channelName - the channel to send the KNOCK for.

      • removeChannel

        void removeChannel(@NonNull String channel,
                   @Nullable String reason)
        Removes a channel from the client, leaving as necessary.
        Parameters:
        channel - channel to leave
        reason - part reason
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if channel is null

      • sendCtcpMessage

        void sendCtcpMessage(@NonNull String target,
                     @NonNull String message)
        Sends a CTCP message to a target user or channel. Automagically adds the CTCP delimiter around the message and escapes the characters that need escaping when sending a CTCP message.

        Note: CTCP replies should not be sent this way. Catch the message with the PrivateCtcpQueryEvent and reply there or use sendCtcpReply(String, String)

        Parameters:
        target - the destination of the message
        message - the message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for null parameters

      • sendCtcpMessage

        default void sendCtcpMessage(@NonNull MessageReceiver target,
                             @NonNull String message)
        Sends a CTCP message to a target user or channel. Automagically adds the CTCP delimiter around the message and escapes the characters that need escaping when sending a CTCP message.

        Note: CTCP replies should not be sent this way. Catch the message with the PrivateCtcpQueryEvent and reply there or use sendCtcpReply(MessageReceiver, String)

        Parameters:
        target - the destination of the message
        message - the message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for null parameters

      • sendCtcpReply

        void sendCtcpReply(@NonNull String target,
                   @NonNull String message)
        Sends a CTCP reply to a target user or channel. Automagically adds the CTCP delimiter around the message and escapes the characters that need escaping when sending a CTCP message.
        Parameters:
        target - the destination of the message
        message - the message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for null parameters

      • sendMultiLineMessage

        default void sendMultiLineMessage(@NonNull String target,
                                  @NonNull String message)
        Sends a potentially multi-line message to a target user or channel using the client's current Cutter.

        Note that bots may not react appropriately to a message split across multiple lines.

        Parameters:
        target - the destination of the message
        message - the message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for null parameters

      • sendMultiLineMessage

        void sendMultiLineMessage(@NonNull String target,
                          @NonNull String message,
                          @NonNull Cutter cutter)
        Sends a potentially multi-line message to a target user or channel using the defined Cutter.

        Note that bots may not react appropriately to a message split across multiple lines.

        Parameters:
        target - the destination of the message
        message - the message to send
        cutter - cutter to utilize
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for null parameters

      • sendRawLine

        Sends a raw IRC message.
        Parameters:
        message - message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if message is null

      • sendRawLineAvoidingDuplication

        void sendRawLineAvoidingDuplication(@NonNull String message)
        Sends a raw IRC message, unless the exact same message is already in the queue of messages not yet sent.
        Parameters:
        message - message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if message is null

      • sendRawLineImmediately

        void sendRawLineImmediately(@NonNull String message)
        Sends a raw IRC message, disregarding message delays and all sanity. Live life on the wild side with this method designed to ensure you get flood-kicked before you finish dumping your life's work into chat.
        Parameters:
        message - message to send dangerously, you monster
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if message is null

      • setExceptionListener

        void setExceptionListener(@Nullable Consumer<Exception> listener)
        Sets a listener for all thrown exceptions on this client.

        All exceptions are passed from a single, separate thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - catcher of throwable objects

      • setDefaultMessageMap

        void setDefaultMessageMap(@NonNull DefaultMessageMap defaults)
        Sets the message manager for default messages to reply with when certain messages are being sent. Like a KICK, PART, or QUIT reason.
        Parameters:
        defaults - DefaultMessageMap to set

      • setInputListener

        void setInputListener(@Nullable Consumer<String> listener)
        Sets a listener for all incoming messages from the server.

        All messages are passed from a single, separate thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - input listener

      • setMessageCutter

        void setMessageCutter(@NonNull Cutter cutter)
        Sets the default message cutter to use for multi-line messages.
        Parameters:
        cutter - cutter to set

        void setMessageSendingQueueSupplier(@NonNull Function<Client.WithManagement,? extends MessageSendingQueue> supplier)
        Sets the message sending queue supplier.
        Parameters:
        supplier - the supplier

      • setNick

        void setNick(@NonNull String nick)
        Sets the nick the client wishes to use.
        Parameters:
        nick - new nickname
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if nick is null

      • setOutputListener

        void setOutputListener(@Nullable Consumer<String> listener)
        Sets a listener for all outgoing messages to the server.

        All messages are passed from a single, separate thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - output listener

      • connect

        void connect()
        Begin connecting to the server.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the client is already connecting

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shuts down the client without a quit message.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown(@Nullable String reason)
        Shuts down the client.
        Parameters:
        reason - quit message to send
